column4: Ubuntu has been hanging a lot lately; hanging to the point I have to restart the entire computer.  When it's happened, the only applications open (other than normal GNOME stuff) were Firefox and GNOME Terminal.  Is there any way to tell whether the hangs were caused by Firefox or by the Ubuntu base system?
maybe    alt+sysRQ+r then alt+sysRQ+e    if that responds it's an app   if not it's kernel level   i/o  maybe.
that's a possibility, at least if stuff really is responding, though at this point I'd doubt it
note that will kill everything.   so probably  ctrl+alt+del for a restart afterwards.
